SEARCH
Package it.polimi.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.observer.Observable<GameView>
it.polimi.model.Game
public class Game extends Observable<GameView>
Game class contains the actual game, identified by an id and containing all the necessary items to play
Author:
Nicola Siniscalchi

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int playersNumber, int commonGoalsNumber) throws PlayersNumberException, CommonGoalsNumberException, FileNotFoundException
      Creates the Game, setting all the parameters
      Parameters:
      playersNumber - how many player will play this game
      commonGoalsNumber - with how many commonGoals this game will be played
      Throws:
      PlayersNumberException - when playersNumber is less than 2 or more than 4
      CommonGoalsNumberException - when commonGoalsNumber is less than 1 or more than 2
      FileNotFoundException - if a file is not found when building parts of the game (like LivingRoomBoard which is built from a json)

  • Method Details

    • setupBoardObjects

      public void setupBoardObjects()
      Sets the LivingRoomBoard at the start of the game, placing the cards on the tiles to fullfil the board based on how many players will play and setting for each tile the correct number of free sides in their attribute

    • setupCommonGoals

      public void setupCommonGoals()
      Picks the commonGoals from the deck, initialize them with the correct amount of points based on how many players will play the game and sets the equivalent attribute of the board in the game

    • setupPersonalGoals

      public void setupPersonalGoals()
      Picks one random personal goal for each player and sets it the player's equivalent attribute

    • setupFirstPlayer

      public void setupFirstPlayer()
      Casually decides who is the first player to play and sets the relative position of the other players

    • getDone

      public boolean getDone()
      Checks if the game has ended
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, else false

    • setDone

      public void setDone(boolean done)
      Sets done if the game has ended
      Parameters:
      done -

    • getEndGamePoints

      public int getEndGamePoints()
      Returns:
      how many bonus points will be assigned to the player completing its bookshelf first

    • getPlayersNumber

      public int getPlayersNumber()
      Returns:
      the number of players in the game

    • getCommonGoalsNumber

      public int getCommonGoalsNumber()
      Returns:
      the number of commonGoalsNumber with which the game is played

    • getTable

      public Player[] getTable()
      Returns:
      a table containing all the players in the game

    • setTable

      public void setTable(Player player, int position)
      Sets the passed player and its position in the array
      Parameters:
      player - the player with all its attributes
      position - its relative position from the first player

    • getBoard

      public LivingRoomBoard getBoard()
      Returns:
      the LivingRoomBoard in the actual state

    • getBag

      public CardsBag getBag()
      Returns:
      the cards bag in the actual state

    • getPersonalGoalsDeck

      public List<PersonalGoalCard> getPersonalGoalsDeck()
      Returns:
      the deck of PersonalGoals (as in the physical game)

    • getCommonGoalsDeck

      public List<CommonGoalCard> getCommonGoalsDeck()
      Returns:
      the deck of CommonGoals (as in the physical game)

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public int getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns:
      the position in the array of the player currently playing

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer(int array_position)
      Sets the player currently playing
      Parameters:
      array_position - its position in the array

    • getLeaderboard

      public Player[] getLeaderboard()
      Returns:
      leaderboard array ordered by the points gained by each player during the game

    • setLeaderboard

      public void setLeaderboard(Player[] leaderboard)
      Sets the leaderboard
      Parameters:
      leaderboard - the leaderboard array to set

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      Changes the currentPlayer to the next player following the order

    • updateCommonGoals

      public void updateCommonGoals(CommonGoalCard commonGoal)
      If the currentPlayer satisfy the common goal, this method adds to the player the equivalent points
      Parameters:
      commonGoal - the goal satisfied

    • handleTurn

      public void handleTurn(String turnPlayerMessage, String otherPlayersMessage)
      Method to handle actual turn
      Parameters:
      turnPlayerMessage - message to display to the current player
      otherPlayersMessage - message to display to the other players

    • insertInOrder

      public void insertInOrder(int[] order)
      Method to insert the picked tiles in the bookshelf in the desidered order
      Parameters:
      order - the array containing the order to insert the tiles in the board

    • endTurnChecks

      public void endTurnChecks()
      At the end of each turn checks if the LivingRoomBoard is empty, if the bookshelf is full (and so the game is finished), if any goal is satisfied

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard()
      Called if the LivingRoomBoard needs to be repopulated, it places tiles in every free spot

    • DeclareWinner

      public void DeclareWinner()
      Declare the winner and calculate the leaderboard
